channel.title: Another few questions :D
channel.description: Well, I know i posted a question early yesterday. But nobody really helped. Questions? How can someone connect to my 317 server? I've had a mate try connecting to my 317 server through moparscape webclient And silab webclient but he can't get in. I'm using Runewings source link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,460585.0.html Can someone recomand a source? And how do i open .class files? Last question can someone try connecting? OH and if someone could come on TEamVeiwer and try to help me :D That would be lovely

item.title: Another few questions :D
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/
I personally think that’s a great place to start learning Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Another few questions :D
item.dc:creator: @jabezxa jabezxa
item.description:
@jabezxa wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:5, topic:364862”]Read the tutorial in the “Tutorial Section” on how to set up a server, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html.

I recommend learning Java and a scripting language like Python and then working your way up to a scratch server like Hyperion, you could also write your own scratch by the time you get to Hyperion, but since your at your basics, I suggest a WinterLove. Why would you want to open your .class files, those are in a binary format that you cannot read. Please remove your ip as it is considered advertising.[/quote]
I consider it helping, As yet nobody can connect. anyways i’ll remove it. And thanks for the info i follow all of the tuts, still yet nothing. and dillktm65 are you even coming on?

Read full topic

item.title: Another few questions :D
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Read the tutorial in the “Tutorial Section” on how to set up a server, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html.

I recommend learning Java and a scripting language like Python and then working your way up to a scratch server like Hyperion, you could also write your own scratch by the time you get to Hyperion, but since your at your basics, I suggest a WinterLove. Why would you want to open your .class files, those are in a binary format that you cannot read. Please remove your ip as it is considered advertising.

Read full topic

[quote=“dillktm65, post:2, topic:364862”]Hey Have team Viewer? Ill help With The Connecting.[/quote] No, But i’ll download it now
And divine i have port forward i’ve tried port checker it says it’s open. and thanks for other info.

Read full topic

item.title: Another few questions :D
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

Connecting problem: Are You sure you have your port open? Have you port forwarded correctly (or at all for that matter)?

There really isn’t any “Best” source as far as I’m concerned, it’s based on preference. Some of the most popular are Project Insanity, AllStar, Delta, etc.

You can just open .class files with notepad, but that really won’t help you with anything. It’s the compiled form that the computer can read. To get a .class file you compile your .java file. The computer turns your source code into bytecode.

Read full topic
